entry.title: Proposal: bip32 version bytes for segwit scripts
entry.summary: The email thread involves a discussion on expanding the number of version prefixes to eliminate ambiguity regarding P2SH scripts. However, Thomas Voegtlin expresses concerns about the difficulty of reaching consensus and the need for extra safeguards if this were to be implemented. He proposes the "xyz" proposal as a simpler solution that would require minimal changes to existing software. While separating P2SH from P2PKH may have some benefits, it is not as strong due to the infinite possibilities of P2SH scripts. Kabuto signs off with their PGP fingerprint.
